p:
In agreement with our hypothesis which predicted AM fungi help facilitate the success of a mycotrophic invasive plant in competition with a domestic plant, our study shows that there were negative effects of AM fungi on proportional total biomass and P content of native I. conyzae. Our results indicate that the presence of AM fungi enhanced the competitive ability of invasive E. sphaerocephalus against native I. conyzae. This is in agreement with Callaway et al.
59 , and Workman and Cruzan
60 who reported positive effects of AM fungi on biomass production of invasive Centaurea melitensis and Brachypodium sylvaticum, respectively, growing in competition with native plants.
